Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?

ALLEGATION:
On December 11, 2020, around 10:30 AM, unknown staff members were not
wearing face masks or face coverings.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Foster Care Worker 1 via telephone on December 14, 2020. I informed
Foster Care Worker 1 regarding the allegations. She reported that when she has
completed visits at Optimist House, staff have not always worn masks.
I interviewed Optimist House Staff 1 face-to-face on-site on December 15, 2020. Staff 1
said she has been employed as a direct care worker since January 2020. She reported I
2

I interviewed Optimist House Staff 1 face-to-face on-site on December 15, 2020. Staff 1
stated she was working the morning of December 11, 2020. She said she recalls that
she had just finished eating her food and her mask was off when a youth’s foster care
worker came to the facility. She reported she was temporarily not wearing her mask
when she was eating. Staff 1 said she always wears her mask during her shift.
I interviewed Optimist House Staff 2 face-to-face on-site on December 15, 2020. Staff 2
reported she has been employed as a direct care worker for three years. She stated she
has been wearing a mask everyday while on duty since the agency has required staff to
wear masks. She reported she did not work the morning shift on December 11, 2020.
I interviewed Youth A face-to-face on-site on December 15, 2020. Youth A reported he
has been placed at Optimist House for approximately five to six months. He said staff
wear masks most of the time. He reported staff do not wear masks when they are
outside.
I interviewed Youth B face-to-face on-site on December 15, 2020. Youth B reported he
does not know how long he has been placed at Optimist House. He initially stated the
staff do not wear masks. He then said that he does not pay attention to whether or not
staff wear masks. Youth B said youth and staff wear masks when they go out in public.
I interviewed Youth C face-to-face on-site on December 15, 2020. Youth C stated he
has been placed at Optimist House for two years. He reported staff wear masks all the
time. He said he does not recall a time when staff has not worn masks.
I interviewed Youth D face-to-face on-site on December 15, 2020. Youth D stated he
has been placed at Optimist House for ten months. He stated staff wear masks all the
time. He said the youth only wear masks when they leave the house and are in public.
I received and reviewed an email on December 15, 2020 from Foster Care Worker 2.
She reported usually, when she visits, staff are wearing masks. However, when she
went to Optimist House on December 14, 2020, staff were not wearing masks.
I received and reviewed Optimist House correspondence and policy updates regarding
the mask requirement on December 15, 2020. Staff received correspondence and
policy updates on May 4, 2020; May 7, 2020; May 13, 2020; June 3, 2020; June 5,
2020; July 10, 2020; and October 16, 2020, informing them that all staff members and
visitors of a residential care facility, congregate care facility, or juvenile justice facility
must wear a covering over their nose and mouth when indoors or within six feet of
another person.
On December 22, 2020, I reviewed video footage for December 11, 2020 at 10:30 a.m.
The video footage showed Staff 1 not wearing a mask while sitting on the couch at the
facility and in the same room with a youth.
3

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: Based on interviews that were conducted and video footage that
was reviewed, there is sufficient evidence to support the
allegations that on December 11, 2020 at 10:30 a.m. Staff 1 was
not following Optimist House policy regarding staff wearing
masks when indoors or within six feet of another person.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend that the facility
maintain a regular license.
